metadata.name: Gradient Study vol.2 #35
metadata.description:
This is an exploration of gradient algorithms to create a piece of abstract art with harmonic color combinations and compositions. There are several types of patterns and compositions and different color palettes. This artwork is created from hundreds of thousands of points, so rendering it requires quite a lot of CPU and may take some time.

Press ’s’ on the live mode to save the artwork.

Made with P5js.

metadata.name: Self, Ego #64
metadata.description:
The third and final installment of the Self trilogy.

Ego is defined as: the one of the three divisions of the psyche in psychoanalytic theory that serves as the organized conscious mediator between the person and reality especially by functioning both in the perception of and adaptation to reality.

Please see attached fx(text) article or go to https://ty-vek.art/self-trilogy for more on concept/mechanics/etc. It’s a bit of long read, but worth it.

This is an fx(params) project and you will be able to choose exactly what your iteration will look like. For more details on why this is a params project and how to approach that, check out the article.

—————————

All projects are written in vanilla Javascript, composed as SVG and then rendered to a 2d canvas.

There might be slight differences in rendering from browser to browser. This is expected as they might translate the SVG slightly differently. Let's call Chromium renderings canonical. They also render faster there and we love that.

Press "S" to save a PNG.
Press "V" to save a SVG. (Chromium browsers render these pretty well.)

By default, these will render at 2400 x 3200 pixels. This is at density 1.

To render at a larger resolution you can append “&d=2” to the end of the url. This will double the resolution. You can also use 3 or 4 or whatever your browser can handle. Safari tends to have problems with this, so stick with Chromium based browsers (Chrome, Edge, Brave, etc.)

If you want to render as a square image, so it is optimized for ummm.. your pfp or something, you can append “&sq=t” to the url.

If you want to get rid of grain, just append “&g=n”

—————————

https://ty-vek.art/self-trilogy
https://twitter.com/ty__vek
https://www.fxhash.xyz/u/Ty%20Vek/articles

metadata.name: Annum #255
metadata.description:
This project is being released in celebration of the 1 year aniversary of Achromat, my first release on fxhash. In addition to being inspired by Achromat, aspects of other previous projects have been incorporated. My deepest gratitude to all who have collected my work over the past year.

In live mode, add &size=<YOUR_PIXEL_SIZE> to change the pixel size of the image for export (Right click to save). For example, &size=4000 will set the width of the image to be 4000 pixels.

50% of primary sales go to Savepakistan.

metadata.name: a reveure! #61
metadata.description:
‘a reveure!’ is a catalan farewell expression. this collection is a souvenir to celebrate me meeting up with artists, collectors and friends during 2023’s summer art events (Responsive Dreams in Barcelona and NFT Show Europe in Valencia). 
mechanics to get a piece: say ‘hi’ and chat with me to get a free pass to mint your iteration and its signed miniprint. i’ll be doing mobile live minting on small screen (iPad/phone) during Barcelona and Valencia events. 

‘a reveure!’ is about simplifying my painting brushes style used in previous works, in an attempt to find minimalist and more conceptual approach. using only black and white and minimizing the use of random, i explore the void and the spaces generated on the canvas, discovering how abstract sculpture-like figures emerge. raw edges and big brushes make the eye confused as it seems 3D shapes building up. 

this line of work and the concept behind it was inspired by Elena Asins’ computer art from late XX’s century.

the motion restarts every 20sec
press [s] or click/touch to save an image
press [r] to reload 
press [1] - [9] to make higher resolution
press [c] to make brushes spin
press left/right arrows to move brushes left/right

made with love and p5js

thank you fxhash team to give me the opportunity and tools to do this special mobile live minting

Marc L Clapers / mekhno
summer 2023

metadata.name: A plateful of noodles #230
metadata.description:
This is a grid based collision experiment.

The work is built entirely on thi.ng/umbrella libraries and template:

https://github.com/thi-ng/fxhash-tpl

Keyboard shortcuts

- space bar : pause/resume animation
- 2 : render @ 2 x resolution
- 4 : render @ 4 x resolution
- x : download canvas as PNG @ current resolution
- s : download canvas as SVG @ current resolution; This can be used with a plotter.

metadata.name: Entropy Blender #49
metadata.description:
This is about a word that doesn't exist and it's exactly what the heart wants to scream. The message you dance, the story you hope the skin delivers.

Image composition made of CGA generated with Sims 4 inputs and blended with PureSpider template.

objkt.name: E R E B U S #239

metadata.name: E R E B U S #239
metadata.description:
Fragments of minds

Our daily life is filled with automatisms, habits that make our comfort zone. Then one day an event occurs that touches us deeply. We step out of our comfort zone, an internal emotional tornado is unleashed in our consciousness. This work tries to illustrate this flow of passion, this emotional violence on the fabric of daily life.

About features.
There are 3 random characteristics:

1. Latent state of mind
This feature correspond to the lines in the background. ‘Healthy’ is the most frequent, and the other types appear more rarely (’Psychotic’ is really rare).

2. Crystallization

This feature corresponds to the strength of the flow of the passion in our mind. Probability : ‘Normal’ = 77%, ‘Strong’ = 33%.

3. Disturbance
The disturbance rate is ’Low’ (frequent), or ‘High’ (rare).

When a work is collected, a process of synchronicity is triggered. Synchronicity is a process of randomness that allows us to communicate with our unconscious (psychological paradigm) or with the hidden forces of the universe (spiritual paradigm). The rarer an image is, the more it represents an exceptional psychic state.

To print a high resolution image (resolution is 6400*6400px.), press [p].
To print a screen resolution image, right-clic then ‘save image’.

This artwork celebrate the anniversary of FxHash - Happy Birthday little baby :-)
50% of primary sales are donate to the Processing Foundation (thank you for making my days better).

Artwork by @GenerativePunk.

issuer.name: E R E B U S

metadata.name: Zephyr #282
metadata.description:
The name Zephyr traces back to Zephyrus, the Greek god of the west wind, and refers to any light breeze. The flowing particles get pushed around by a zephyr, creating interesting and organic patterns.

Live Mode Controls:

- Default is 2000x2000 pixel canvas. Press “1” for 1000x1000px canvas, “3” for 3000x3000px, “4” for 4000x4000px
- Press 'p' to save a png of the canvas.

Created using p5.js

Licensed under CC BY-NC 4.0

metadata.name: fx(mandala) #48
metadata.description:
Outer mandalas represent the universe or world-system and are traditionally offered as thank you gifts. In this case it’s my offering to the fxhash community as a celebration of #fxhashturnsone. 

SOME MINTS WILL BE GOLDEN TICKETS
A golden ticket AND the iteration directly before it will each receive a free 8 x 10in special edition signed physical made from 12 layers of laser cut museum board. 

Physicals for all mints can be requested and/or claimed at https://alleditions.art

Outer Mandalas is part of a broader series I am working on that explores the use of techniques and patterns from sacred geometries using generative randomness. I use generative algorithms to create “blueprints” that can be transferred out of the physical realm and into the real world as multi-layered three dimensional sculptures. 

I create limited edition physical “prints” for Outer Mandalas by using a high powered laser to precisely cut through 4-ply museum boards (the same stuff you frame a picture with) to create 12 unique layers. I then stack and carefully glue each layer together in order to create a dynamic relief that plays with light and shadow. These pieces are visually engaging artworks that tend to spark conversation whenever they are seen.  

A big thank you to the fxhash platform team and all the passionate collectors and generative artists I’ve met over the past year. It’s been my honor to be a part of this amazing community. 

s to save as a layered SVG 
p to save as a PNG
e to explode the layers
Click and drag the mouse to change the shadows. 

This generative is VERY intensive and probably won’t render very well on a mobile device.

metadata.name: 空-sora- #354
metadata.description:
Japanese word Sora(空) means Sky.

An abstract painting of a landscape with sky.
Drawing based on mathematics fractal.

Top has 3 variations.
Bottom has 4 variations.
Cloud has 3 variations.
Background has White or Black 2 variations.
Stroke has ON or OFF 2 variations.

Controls (in live view):
- Press [f] to switch full screen on and off
- Press [s] to download a PNG file with windowsize
- Press [l] to download a PNG file with large size 3200 x 4800 pixel (wait a minutes)

Create with p5.js
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: waves #431
metadata.description:
generative set of glitchy waves warping pixels

made with cablesgl

* the thumbnail is in a very low resolution and it do not represent very well the actual token (which is in a good resolution)
*requires the use of dedicated gpu for run with a good fps
